revised_title: On the Vapour-Pressures of Ice, Camphor, Benzene, Acetic Acid, and Water
tldr: The author conducted experiments to measure the vapour-pressures of ice, camphor, benzene, acetic acid, and water. They found that the vapour-pressure of a solid is less than that of a liquid at the same temperature, and that the differences between these pressures can be calculated from thermic data. The author also introduced a new method for determining the vapour-pressures of solids and liquids, which offers significant advantages over previous methods.
